title: Sebastian Hanika
text:
I am a PhD student at the Department of Human Geography at Lund University, specializing in the intersection between Human Geography and demography.
My research focuses on spatial variations in population aging and labor market participation of older workers. I have a strong interest in quantitative methods, particularly R programming and GIS.

title: Research
text: My PhD research focuses on spatial variations in population aging and the labor market participation of older workers. I have a strong interest in quantitative methods, particularly R programming and geoinformatics.

title: Teaching
text: I began teaching at the university level in March 2023. Moving forward, my goal is to create more interactive materials and exercises for teaching quantitative methods. Additionally, I have plans to deliver guest lectures in population or economic geography, aligning with my research interests.

title: Teaching
text:
Courses

Applied methods in planning
I taught the module on quantitative methods and statistics, which encompassed lectures, seminars, and lab exercises. Throughout the course, I delivered a total of 12 hours of in-classroom teaching. I also had responsibility for grading assignments and assessments.

title: Teaching
text:
Supervision

Degree project in Human Geography
I supervised two students for their degree projects in Human Geography as part of the SGEA23 course.
